page.title: 05 The Peoples Palace.
page.content: Built in 1898 in the intensely industrial east-end of Glasgow to serve as a place of recreation for the working-class people.Based on only similar building in east-end London. Designed and constructed by city engineers with money raised from east-end business exhibitions and compensation paid by railway. Popular at first but by 1960 builing was very derelict.Restoration work began and by 1984 200,000 visitors (80,000 more than 1983).Now-Mueseum showing history of life and indistry of Glasgow. Exhibits-all donated.One third of collection on display at any time.Run by Glasgow District Council-funded through rates. Winter Garden-Temporary art displays, weddings, parties, bands, billiards, fashion shows, etc.
